name: interinfluence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an effect that two or more things have on each other: We do not need to assume any interinfluence among these words. One can discern the inter-influence between artist and society.
More examplesFewer examplesThe treatment owes something independently to each model and a great deal to the inter-influence of the two.The author seems to think that methodology and ideology are not just distinct but should be incapable of inter-influence.It is these individuals who serve, to a large extent, as the media of cultural interinfluences.
